intro: Ruschia monticola, commonly known as the mountain Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is a popular choice among gardeners in arid regions.
